item.title: Europe stocks lower; Broadcaster Canal+ falls in London debut as former parent Vivendi jumps 33%
item.description: European markets opened lower on Monday, as traders gear up for the final Federal Reserve meeting of the year.

item.title: French broadcaster Canal+ shares fall 16% in London listing after spinoff from Vivendi
item.description: Shares in French broadcaster Canal+ fell over 13% following their London stock market debut Monday.

item.title: Stock futures rise slightly as Wall Street gets ready for Fed meeting this week: Live updates
item.description: The Dow is on a seven-day losing streak entering the week.

item.title: China's November retail sales miss expectations as real estate slump deepens
item.description: The latest economic data out of China underscores lingering doubts about consumer spending.

item.title: South Korea markets end Monday mixed after President Yoon's impeachment
item.description: Both indexes had rebounded strongly last week after initially falling after the martial law flip-flop and failed first impeachment vote.
